definition[0]: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job
example[0]: I handled most of the paperwork.
example[1]: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
example[2]: The finance department handles all the accounts.
example[3]: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
definition[1]: to deal with a situation or problem by behaving in a particular way and making particular decisions
example[4]: The headmaster handled the situation very well.
example[5]: I knew I had handled the matter badly.
example[6]: Leave it to me. I can handle it.
example[7]: Most customers were satisfied with the way their complaints were handled.
example[8]: Opposition leaders will be watching carefully to see how the prime minister handles the crisis.
definition[2]: to deal with a person or behave towards them in a particular way, especially in order to keep them happy
example[9]: Some customers are quite difficult to handle.
definition[3]: to not become upset in a difficult situation
example[10]: She can’t handle it when people criticize her.
example[11]: He doesn’t handle stress very well.
definition[4]: to touch something or pick it up and hold it in your hands
example[12]: He had never handled a weapon before.
example[13]: We teach the children to handle the animals gently.
example[14]: He was roughly handled by the mob.
definition[5]: to control the movement of a vehicle or an animal
example[15]: I didn’t know if I’d be able to handle such a large vehicle.
definition[6]: the way a vehicle handles is how easy it is to control
example[16]: The car handles well, even on wet roads.
definition[7]: to move goods from one place to another
example[17]: The Post Office handles nearly 2 billion letters and parcels over the Christmas period.
example[18]: Bennet was charged with handling stolen goods.
definition[9]: the part of a door that you use for opening it
example[19]: Then he turned the handle and went in.
definition[10]: the part of an object that you use for holding it
example[20]: a knife with a carved wooden handle
definition[11]: to deal with a difficult situation or problem
example[23]: First-time travelers get some peace of mind when an agency handles everything.
definition[12]: to deal with a particular client or product
example[24]: She handles all our major clients.
definition[13]: if you handle a particular job, you are responsible for doing it
example[25]: He will handle merchandising and advertising as well as retaining his duties as president.
definition[14]: to buy, sell, or deal with goods or services in business or trade
example[26]: Domestic car manufacturers have said their dealers are free to handle foreign cars if they wish.
definition[15]: to move goods etc from one place to another
example[27]: We handle large volumes of imported goods.
